title: Blueprint Event Driven Cutscene System
description: Blueprint Cutscene System Inspired by Classic JRPGs
longDescription:
---- NEW UPDATE ----

Update for 4.27 out now! (finally)


  • New Command Action - Classic Dialogue Textbox with Typewriter effect!

-----------------------

Watch this VIDEO to see the system in action. Video is of the example level provided in the asset.


This is a Blueprint System designed with the goal of creating gamplay cutscenes similar to those seen in classic JRPGs. Though it can be used for any genre of game!


You are able to build cutscenes within a Cutscene Blueprint very easily, with 2 commented example cutscene BPs to show you what to do. The system contains 11 prebuilt Command Actions that can be used to create your cutscenes [current actions include; Say(Dialogue box), MoveToLocation, TurnToRotation, SwitchCamera, FadeCamera + more]. Making a cutscene is as easy as calling a Cmd function and setting parameter values of your choosing.


The system is very easy to expand on (I encourage you to experiment!), you can create child BPs of the MasterCommand BP to create your own Command Actions. (BP_MasterCommand has comments inside to explain how to do it).


This system solely handles Cutscenes, it does not handle quests, story progression etc...

technicalDetails:
Features:

  •  Make cutscenes using Blueprints
  •  11 prebuilt Command Actions to get you started
  •  Create your own Command Actions easily
  • Master Blueprints have been fully commented to explain how the system works and how you can expand on it
  • 2 Example Cutscenes made for you to look at for reference

Number of Blueprints: 20

Input: Uses WASD for movement, Mouse to Look, and Press E to continue the cutscenes when prompted.

Network Replicated: No

Supported Development Platforms: Any, isn't platform specific

Windows: Yes

Mac: Yes
